speaker: SALISBURY

string: For I do see the cruel pangs of death
speaker: SALISBURY

string: Right in thine eye. Away, my friends! New flight;
speaker: SALISBURY

string: And happy newness, that intends old right.
speaker: SALISBURY

string: Exeunt, leading off MELUN
SCENE V. The French camp.
Enter LEWIS and his train
LEWIS
speaker: LEWIS

string: The sun of heaven methought was loath to set,
speaker: LEWIS

string: But stay'd and made the western welkin blush,
speaker: LEWIS

string: When English measure backward their own ground
speaker: LEWIS

string: In faint retire. O, bravely came we off,
speaker: LEWIS

string: When with a volley of our needless shot,
speaker: LEWIS

string: After such bloody toil, we bid good night;
speaker: LEWIS

string: And wound our tattering colours clearly up,
speaker: LEWIS

string: Last in the field, and almost lords of it!
speaker: LEWIS

string: Enter a Messenger
Messenger
speaker: Messenger

string: Where is my prince, the Dauphin?
speaker: Messenger

string: LEWIS
speaker: LEWIS

string: Here: what news?
speaker: LEWIS

string: Messenger
speaker: Messenger

string: The Count Melun is slain; the English lords
speaker: Messenger

string: By his persuasion are again fall'n off,
speaker: Messenger

string: And your supply, which you have wish'd so long,
speaker: Messenger

string: Are cast away and sunk on Goodwin Sands.
speaker: Messenger

string: LEWIS
speaker: LEWIS

string: Ah, foul shrewd news! beshrew thy very heart!
speaker: LEWIS

string: I did not think to be so sad to-night
speaker: LEWIS

string: As this hath made me. Who was he that said
speaker: LEWIS

string: King John did fly an hour or two before
speaker: LEWIS

string: The stumbling night did part our weary powers?
speaker: LEWIS

string: Messenger
speaker: Messenger

string: Whoever spoke it, it is true, my lord.
speaker: Messenger

string: LEWIS
speaker: LEWIS

string: Well; keep good quarter and good care to-night:
speaker: LEWIS

string: The day shall not be up so soon as I,
speaker: LEWIS

string: To try the fair adventure of to-morrow.
speaker: LEWIS

string: Exeunt
SCENE VI. An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.
Enter the BASTARD and HUBERT, severally
HUBERT
speaker: HUBERT

string: Who's there? speak, ho! speak quickly, or I shoot.
speaker: HUBERT

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: A friend. What art thou?
speaker: BASTARD

string: HUBERT
speaker: HUBERT

string: Of the part of England.
speaker: HUBERT

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: Whither dost thou go?
speaker: BASTARD

string: HUBERT
speaker: HUBERT

string: What's that to thee? why may not I demand
speaker: HUBERT

string: Of thine affairs, as well as thou of mine?
speaker: HUBERT

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: Hubert, I think?
speaker: BASTARD

string: HUBERT
speaker: HUBERT

string: Thou hast a perfect thought:
speaker: HUBERT

string: I will upon all hazards well believe
speaker: HUBERT

string: Thou art my friend, that know'st my tongue so well.
speaker: HUBERT

string: Who art thou?
speaker: HUBERT

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: Who thou wilt: and if thou please,
speaker: BASTARD

string: Thou mayst befriend me so much as to think
speaker: BASTARD

string: I come one way of the Plantagenets.
speaker: BASTARD

string: HUBERT
speaker: HUBERT

string: Unkind remembrance! thou and eyeless night
speaker: HUBERT

string: Have done me shame: brave soldier, pardon me,
speaker: HUBERT

string: That any accent breaking from thy tongue
speaker: HUBERT

string: Should 'scape the true acquaintance of mine ear.
speaker: HUBERT

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: Come, come; sans compliment, what news abroad?
speaker: BASTARD

string: HUBERT
speaker: HUBERT

string: Why, here walk I in the black brow of night,
speaker: HUBERT

string: To find you out.
speaker: HUBERT

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: Brief, then; and what's the news?
speaker: BASTARD

string: HUBERT
speaker: HUBERT

string: O, my sweet sir, news fitting to the night,
speaker: HUBERT

string: Black, fearful, comfortless and horrible.
speaker: HUBERT

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: Show me the very wound of this ill news:
speaker: BASTARD

string: I am no woman, I'll not swoon at it.
speaker: BASTARD

string: HUBERT
speaker: HUBERT

string: The king, I fear, is poison'd by a monk:
speaker: HUBERT

string: I left him almost speechless; and broke out
speaker: HUBERT

string: To acquaint you with this evil, that you might
speaker: HUBERT

string: The better arm you to the sudden time,
speaker: HUBERT

string: Than if you had at leisure known of this.
speaker: HUBERT

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: How did he take it? who did taste to him?
speaker: BASTARD

string: HUBERT
speaker: HUBERT

string: A monk, I tell you; a resolved villain,
speaker: HUBERT

string: Whose bowels suddenly burst out: the king
speaker: HUBERT

string: Yet speaks and peradventure may recover.
speaker: HUBERT

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: Who didst thou leave to tend his majesty?
speaker: BASTARD

string: HUBERT
speaker: HUBERT

string: Why, know you not? the lords are all come back,
speaker: HUBERT

string: And brought Prince Henry in their company;
speaker: HUBERT

string: At whose request the king hath pardon'd them,
speaker: HUBERT

string: And they are all about his majesty.
speaker: HUBERT

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: Withhold thine indignation, mighty heaven,
speaker: BASTARD

string: And tempt us not to bear above our power!
speaker: BASTARD

string: I'll tell tree, Hubert, half my power this night,
speaker: BASTARD

string: Passing these flats, are taken by the tide;
speaker: BASTARD

string: These Lincoln Washes have devoured them;
speaker: BASTARD

string: Myself, well mounted, hardly have escaped.
speaker: BASTARD

string: Away before: conduct me to the king;
speaker: BASTARD

string: I doubt he will be dead or ere I come.
speaker: BASTARD

string: Exeunt
SCENE VII. The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
Enter PRINCE HENRY, SALISBURY, and BIGOT
PRINCE HENRY
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: It is too late: the life of all his blood
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Is touch'd corruptibly, and his pure brain,
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Which some suppose the soul's frail dwelling-house,
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Doth by the idle comments that it makes
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Foretell the ending of mortality.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Enter PEMBROKE
PEMBROKE
speaker: PEMBROKE

string: His highness yet doth speak, and holds belief
speaker: PEMBROKE

string: That, being brought into the open air,
speaker: PEMBROKE

string: It would allay the burning quality
speaker: PEMBROKE

string: Of that fell poison which assaileth him.
speaker: PEMBROKE

string: PRINCE HENRY
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Let him be brought into the orchard here.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Doth he still rage?
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Exit BIGOT
PEMBROKE
speaker: PEMBROKE

string: He is more patient
speaker: PEMBROKE

string: Than when you left him; even now he sung.
speaker: PEMBROKE

string: PRINCE HENRY
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: O vanity of sickness! fierce extremes
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: In their continuance will not feel themselves.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Death, having prey'd upon the outward parts,
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Leaves them invisible, and his siege is now
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Against the mind, the which he pricks and wounds
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: With many legions of strange fantasies,
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Whi ch, in their throng and press to that last hold,
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Confound themselves. 'Tis strange that death
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: should sing.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: I am the cygnet to this pale faint swan,
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Who chants a doleful hymn to his own death,
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: And from the organ-pipe of frailty sings
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: His soul and body to their lasting rest.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: SALISBURY
speaker: SALISBURY

string: Be of good comfort, prince; for you are born
speaker: SALISBURY

string: To set a form upon that indigest
speaker: SALISBURY

string: Which he hath left so shapeless and so rude.
speaker: SALISBURY

string: Enter Attendants, and BIGOT, carrying KING JOHN in a chair
KING JOHN
speaker: KING JOHN

string: Ay, marry, now my soul hath elbow-room;
speaker: KING JOHN

string: It would not out at windows nor at doors.
speaker: KING JOHN

string: There is so hot a summer in my bosom,
speaker: KING JOHN

string: That all my bowels crumble up to dust:
speaker: KING JOHN

string: I am a scribbled form, drawn with a pen
speaker: KING JOHN

string: Upon a parchment, and against this fire
speaker: KING JOHN

string: Do I shrink up.
speaker: KING JOHN

string: PRINCE HENRY
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: How fares your majesty?
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: KING JOHN
speaker: KING JOHN

string: Poison'd,--ill fare--dead, forsook, cast off:
speaker: KING JOHN

string: And none of you will bid the winter come
speaker: KING JOHN

string: To thrust his icy fingers in my maw,
speaker: KING JOHN

string: Nor let my kingdom's rivers take their course
speaker: KING JOHN

string: Through my burn'd bosom, nor entreat the north
speaker: KING JOHN

string: To make his bleak winds kiss my parched lips
speaker: KING JOHN

string: And comfort me with cold. I do not ask you much,
speaker: KING JOHN

string: I beg cold comfort; and you are so strait
speaker: KING JOHN

string: And so ingrateful, you deny me that.
speaker: KING JOHN

string: PRINCE HENRY
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: O that there were some virtue in my tears,
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: That might relieve you!
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: KING JOHN
speaker: KING JOHN

string: The salt in them is hot.
speaker: KING JOHN

string: Within me is a hell; and there the poison
speaker: KING JOHN

string: Is as a fiend confined to tyrannize
speaker: KING JOHN

string: On unreprievable condemned blood.
speaker: KING JOHN

string: Enter the BASTARD
BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: O, I am scalded with my violent motion,
speaker: BASTARD

string: And spleen of speed to see your majesty!
speaker: BASTARD

string: KING JOHN
speaker: KING JOHN

string: O cousin, thou art come to set mine eye:
speaker: KING JOHN

string: The tackle of my heart is crack'd and burn'd,
speaker: KING JOHN

string: And all the shrouds wherewith my life should sail
speaker: KING JOHN

string: Are turned to one thread, one little hair:
speaker: KING JOHN

string: My heart hath one poor string to stay it by,
speaker: KING JOHN

string: Which holds but till thy news be uttered;
speaker: KING JOHN

string: And then all this thou seest is but a clod
speaker: KING JOHN

string: And module of confounded royalty.
speaker: KING JOHN

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: The Dauphin is preparing hitherward,
speaker: BASTARD

string: Where heaven He knows how we shall answer him;
speaker: BASTARD

string: For in a night the best part of my power,
speaker: BASTARD

string: As I upon advantage did remove,
speaker: BASTARD

string: Were in the Washes all unwarily
speaker: BASTARD

string: Devoured by the unexpected flood.
speaker: BASTARD

string: KING JOHN dies
SALISBURY
speaker: SALISBURY

string: You breathe these dead news in as dead an ear.
speaker: SALISBURY

string: My liege! my lord! but now a king, now thus.
speaker: SALISBURY

string: PRINCE HENRY
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Even so must I run on, and even so stop.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: What surety of the world, what hope, what stay,
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: When this was now a king, and now is clay?
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: Art thou gone so? I do but stay behind
speaker: BASTARD

string: To do the office for thee of revenge,
speaker: BASTARD

string: And then my soul shall wait on thee to heaven,
speaker: BASTARD

string: As it on earth hath been thy servant still.
speaker: BASTARD

string: Now, now, you stars that move in your right spheres,
speaker: BASTARD

string: Where be your powers? show now your mended faiths,
speaker: BASTARD

string: And instantly return with me again,
speaker: BASTARD

string: To push destruction and perpetual shame
speaker: BASTARD

string: Out of the weak door of our fainting land.
speaker: BASTARD

string: Straight let us seek, or straight we shall be sought;
speaker: BASTARD

string: The Dauphin rages at our very heels.
speaker: BASTARD

string: SALISBURY
speaker: SALISBURY

string: It seems you know not, then, so much as we:
speaker: SALISBURY

string: The Cardinal Pandulph is within at rest,
speaker: SALISBURY

string: Who half an hour since came from the Dauphin,
speaker: SALISBURY

string: And brings from him such offers of our peace
speaker: SALISBURY

string: As we with honour and respect may take,
speaker: SALISBURY

string: With purpose presently to leave this war.
speaker: SALISBURY

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

speaker: BASTARD

string: Ourselves well sinewed to our defence.
speaker: BASTARD

string: SALISBURY
speaker: SALISBURY

string: Nay, it is in a manner done already;
speaker: SALISBURY

speaker: SALISBURY

string: To the sea-side, and put his cause and quarrel
speaker: SALISBURY

string: To the disposing of the cardinal:
speaker: SALISBURY

string: With whom yourself, myself and other lords,
speaker: SALISBURY

string: If you think meet, this afternoon will post
speaker: SALISBURY

string: To consummate this business happily.
speaker: SALISBURY

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: Let it be so: and you, my noble prince,
speaker: BASTARD

string: With other princes that may best be spared,
speaker: BASTARD

string: Shall wait upon your father's funeral.
speaker: BASTARD

string: PRINCE HENRY
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: For so he will'd it.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: Thither shall it then:
speaker: BASTARD

string: And happily may your sweet self put on
speaker: BASTARD

string: The lineal state and glory of the land!
speaker: BASTARD

string: To whom with all submission, on my knee
speaker: BASTARD

string: I do bequeath my faithful services
speaker: BASTARD

string: And true subjection everlastingly.
speaker: BASTARD

string: SALISBURY
speaker: SALISBURY

string: And the like tender of our love we make,
speaker: SALISBURY

string: To rest without a spot for evermore.
speaker: SALISBURY

string: PRINCE HENRY
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: I have a kind soul that would give you thanks
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: And knows not how to do it but with tears.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: BASTARD
speaker: BASTARD

string: O, let us pay the time but needful woe,
speaker: BASTARD

string: Since it hath been beforehand with our griefs.
speaker: BASTARD

string: This England never did, nor never shall,
speaker: BASTARD

string: Lie at the proud foot of a conqueror,
speaker: BASTARD

string: But when it first did help to wound itself.
speaker: BASTARD

string: Now these her princes are come home again,
speaker: BASTARD

string: Come the three corners of the world in arms,
speaker: BASTARD

string: And we shall shock them. Nought shall make us rue,
speaker: BASTARD

string: If England to itself do rest but true.
speaker: BASTARD
